Title: 600 - Gluing 1D Shapes to 2D Shapes
Tip: 1D glue requires a non-rendered 'Glue' object that links the 1D source to the 2D target.

Summary.What: When the target shape is moved, all 1D shapes that are glued to it must are notified and modified.
Summary.Why: 1D shapes must adjust their position and orientation to stay connected in the diagram.
Summary.How: Let the 1D shape own the glue, then notify the glue every time the target shape is moved so the 1D shape can adjust itself.
